intro: Synantherias, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. These plants are characterized by their showy, daisy-like flowers with bright yellow centers and white or pink petals. The flowers are typically arranged in dense clusters, creating a striking visual display. Synantherias species are often found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in full sun. They are valued for their ornamental appeal and are commonly cultivated in gardens.
